_header: Queen of heaven make Thou mirth
Subjects: Virgin Mary, prayers to; prayers, to Virgin Mary

BodLauMis213.Transcription:
Quene of heuen mak þu murth& prays god with all þi
                    myghtfor of þe he tok hys burthþat is heele lyf &
                    lyghtHe rose fro deth so sayd heSave vs gode in nede mostePray
                    for vs þe triniteffader & sone & holy gost
BodLauMis213.Note:
Written in verse lines, with rhyme markings to right and Latin
                    supralinear glosses.
BodLauMis213.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 49.
Silverstein,  Theodore,
                        ed.  
             Medieval English Lyrics.
         York Medieval Texts. London: Edw. Arnold, 1971: 77.

BLHar665.First Lines: Quene of heuyn make þu myrthAnd pray god with all þy myȝht…
BLHar665.Last Lines: …pray for vs to þe trinitefadyr & son & holy goost Amen
BLHar665.Note: Two stanzas with Latin interspersed. Written as prose.

Lam306.Transcription:
Quene of hevyn make thou myrthAnd prayse god wyth alle thy
                    myghtffor of the he toke his byrthThat is heele lyfe and lyghtHe
                    rose from deth so sayde heSaue vs god in nede mostPra for vs the
                    trynyteffader and sonne and holy goste
Lam306.Note: With the Latin original in alternate lines in rubric.
Lam306.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Political, Religious and Love Poems, from Lambeth MS. 306 and other
                sources.
EETS
         o.s. 15 (1866); repr. 1962; rev. ed. 1903: 176.
